DataElement.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Procedure Follow-up Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a patient or participant has agreed to return to receive treatment, an action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process or follow-up, the process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed, as part of the act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Therapeutic Procedure Follow-up Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a patient or participant receiving treatment, an action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process or follow-up, the process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed, as part of the act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient will be accessible for treatment and follow-up, and will be treated and followed at the participating centre?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_03
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients who discontinued everolimus due to toxicity will only be permitted to crossover if they have remained in compliance with protocol follow up criteria for disease assessment after discontinuation of everolimus.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_04
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant will be accessible for treatment and follow-up per protocol section 4.1.8 and will be treated and followed at the participating centre.
